parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and dechomai; to admit (figuratively) endurance); by implication, to await.
A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
